dt: {bc}the thick dark to light brown syrup that is separated from raw sugar in sugar manufacture
{bc}a syrup made from boiling down sweet vegetable or fruit juice

et: modification of Portuguese {it}melaço{/it}, from Late Latin {it}mellaceum{/it} grape juice, from Latin {it}mell-, mel{/it} honey {ma}{mat|mellifluous|}{/ma}

a syrup made from boiling down sweet vegetable or fruit juice

dt: {bc}a thick dark molasses obtained from successive processing of raw sugar

et: {it}blackstrap{/it} cheap wine, mixture of rum and molasses
shortdef: a thick dark molasses obtained from successive processing of raw sugar

dt.t: I used to be a fast runner, but now I'm {it}slow as molasses{/it}.
People have complained that the legislature is moving/working {it}slower than molasses{/it}.
